ygData.subject: Re: Guise of the Deceiver
ygData.msgSnippet: Like jboots the guise s effect can be activated by anyone & you needn t be wearing it. This is actually a large annoyance I have with these items, if people
ygData.messageBody:
Like jboots the guise's effect can be activated by anyone & you needn't be
wearing it.

This is actually a large annoyance I have with these items, if people
actually had to wear jboots for them to work, they'd be in ALOT less demand
as the AC on them is pretty low. Also getting a guise for a rogue or bard
wouldn't be as hard.

NoDrops can't be traded, dropped or even banked (which is extremely silly).
As a result yes, if someone loots it, they're stuck with it. The only way
to get rid of it is to destroy it.

-----Original Message-----
From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 <g4mntofcr@...>
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com' <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, August 04, 1999 10:00 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Guise of the Deceiver


>From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>
>I have a couple of questions about this magic item. First, according to
>screenshots on a couple EQ sites, it says the Guise is for bards and rogues
>only. Is this still true? I ran into a barbarian once who had one on. He
>used it to make him smaller so he could get into tight places. I'm almost
>certain he was a warrior (I did a /who on him). Second question is the NO
>DROP flag. The screenshots I saw listed it as a NO DROP item. I don't
have
>much experience with NO DROP items so not certain how this works. If
>someone has one can I buy it from them? What if someone who can't equip it
>loots it off the creature that drops it? Does that mean it is forever
>unusable? Last question, if it can be sold/traded, what is the fair price
>for it?
>
>Thanks
>Galtin of E'ci
>
